result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roger Lee Powell Jr

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order, Signed and Filed

Defendant Roger Lee Powell Jr in court in person, in custody.  Attorney Colleen A Taylor in court in person for Roger Lee Powell Jr.  Attorney Ian Vance-Curzan on behalf of Attorney Chad Wozniak in court in person for State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Scheduling Conference. Defense Counsel confirms appointment to the case with the court. Defense Counsel requests date for Motion Hearing. Both parties agree to set future trial dates. Matter is adjourned.
Modification Hearing scheduled for January 24, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial scheduled for February 8, 2023 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for March 6, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Letter from defendant re:  Denial of Due Process.  (Roger L. Powell, Jr. - #2022006654, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).

Defendant Roger Lee Powell Jr in custody, in court with Attorney Colleen A Taylor and Attorney Theodore OReilly in court for Roger Lee Powell Jr.  Attorney Paul Tiffin for Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Matter in court for Status of counsel.  Counsel has been retained.  Discovery as not yet been received.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
received and filed.
received and filed.
Order for Withdrawal of Counsel, signed and filed.

Defendant Roger Lee Powell Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Gary Raymond George Aty in court with Roger Lee Powell Jr.  Attorney Chad Wozniak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Matter in court on Doctor's Report Return.

Doctor's report received and filed.  Parties reviewed report.  State does not contest the findings.  Defendant do not contest findings.  Court found defendant competent to proceed and reinstated proceedings. 

Defense motions the court to withdraw, per request of the defendant.  

Defendant wishes to proceed without counsel.  Court held colloquy with the defendant. Upon questioning, the Court finds the defendant competent to proceed and knowingly and voluntarily waives right to counsel. 

Counsel has provided the defendant with all discovery except for the thumb drive.

Court GRANTS defense motion to withdraw.
Status conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
NOTICE OF MOTION AND MOTION OF WITHDRAW OF COUNSEL, received and filed.
Order for Withdrawal of Counsel, received.
received and filed.
Defendant's Motion to Proceed without Counsel.  (Roger Powell - #2022006654, Milwaukee County Jail, 949 N 9th St, Milwaukee WI 53233).
Received and Signed. Order for Competency Examination by Department of Health Services
Order for competency evaluation by the department of health services

Defendant Roger Lee Powell in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Defendant Roger Lee Powell in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussions put forth on the record. Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit. Order for Examination, signed and filed. Court further suspends proceedings at this time. Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department. Case adjourned to Br 15.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04B (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Borowski.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Watts, Br. 15.

Defendant's Substitution of Judge.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Roger Lee Powell in court, appear by video with attorney Gary Raymond George, appear in person.  Defendant Roger Lee Powell in custody.  Jennifer Jean Tate appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 12, Judge David Borowski. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 051427,
Payable Number: 1010221,
Receipt Number: 22RP022128,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Court ordered no contact with TRP (1.12.2001)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Roger Lee Powell in court with attorney Gary Raymond George.  Defendant Roger Lee Powell in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Roger Lee Powell appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
